name: switch (xxx)... (for scalar)
description: Copies one of input scalar, specified by the selector, to the output. If the selector is 0, first initialized input will be used.

in_ports.name: selector_input
in_ports.caption: switch (xxx)
in_ports.hint: [Optional] May contain an integer number. In this case, it OVERRIDES the value of "Selector" parameter.

controls.caption: Selector
controls.name: selector
controls.description:
Selecting index of the input port 1..9. Zero value means selecting first initialized "xK" port.
Note: if the port "switch (xxx)" contains non-empty string, this string must be a number, and that number overrides the value of this parameter.

controls.caption: Requires input
controls.name: requireInput
controls.description: If set, and if the selector index is not 0, the input port must contain some initialized scalar; in other case, this function will throw an exception. If this flag is cleared, empty input port, selected by the previous parameter, doesn't lead to any effect: output port will still stay empty.
